user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_str_pct_decode_in_place_lenient_:
```c
size_t
MHD_str_pct_decode_in_place_lenient_ (char *str,
                                      bool *broken_encoding)
{
#ifdef MHD_FAVOR_SMALL_CODE
  size_t len;
  size_t res;

  len = strlen (str);
  res = MHD_str_pct_decode_lenient_n_ (str, len, str, len, broken_encoding);
  str[res] = 0;

  return res;
#else  /* ! MHD_FAVOR_SMALL_CODE */
  size_t r;
  size_t w;
  if (NULL != broken_encoding)
    *broken_encoding = false;
  r = 0;
  w = 0;
  while (0 != str[r])
  {
    const char chr = str[r++];
    if ('%' == chr)
    {
      const char d1 = str[r++];
      if (0 == d1)
      {
        if (NULL != broken_encoding)
          *broken_encoding = true;
        str[w++] = chr; /* Copy "as is" */
        str[w] = 0;
        return w;
      }
      else
      {
        const char d2 = str[r++];
        if (0 == d2)
        {
          if (NULL != broken_encoding)
            *broken_encoding = true;
          str[w++] = chr; /* Copy "as is" */
          str[w++] = d1; /* Copy "as is" */
          str[w] = 0;
          return w;
        }
        else
        {
          const int h = toxdigitvalue (d1);
          const int l = toxdigitvalue (d2);
          unsigned char out;
          if ((0 > h) || (0 > l))
          {
            if (NULL != broken_encoding)
              *broken_encoding = true;
            str[w++] = chr; /* Copy "as is" */
            str[w++] = d1;
            str[w++] = d2;
            continue;
          }
          out =
            (unsigned char) (((uint8_t) (((uint8_t) ((unsigned int) h)) << 4))
                             | ((uint8_t) ((unsigned int) l)));
          str[w++] = (char) out;
          continue;
        }
      }
    }
    str[w++] = chr;
  }
  str[w] = 0;
  return w;
#endif /* ! MHD_FAVOR_SMALL_CODE */
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
res = MHD_str_pct_decode_lenient_n_ (str, len, str, len, broken_encoding);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The call is to MHD_str_pct_decode_lenient_n_, a different function name than MHD_str_pct_decode_in_place_lenient_; therefore this fragment by itself does not show direct recursion and does not violate Rule 17.2. (Note: an indirect violation would occur only if MHD_str_pct_decode_lenient_n_ — or a chain of functions it calls — calls MHD_str_pct_decode_in_place_lenient_ back; verify the definition/callees of MHD_str_pct_decode_lenient_n_ to rule out indirect recursion.)
